required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Magnesium Sulfate Versus Nifedipine for the Acute Tocolysis of Preterm Labor: A Prospective, Randomized Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Magnesium Sulfate Versus Nifedipine for the Acute Tocolysis of Preterm Labor: A Prospective, Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: To compare intravenous magnesium sulfate to oral nifedipine for acute tocolysis of preterm labor

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Prevention of Preterm Delivery for 48 Hours With Attainment of Uterine Quiescence
primary_outcome.time_frame: 48 hours after administration of study medication.
primary_outcome.description: Uterine quiescence defined by 12 hours of six or fewer contractions per hour and no further cervical change within 48 hours of tocolytic initiation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until delivery, up to 42 weeks of gestation
secondary_outcome.description: Uterine quiescence was defined by 12 hours of six of fewer contractions per hour and no further cervical change.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until delivery, up to 42 weeks of gestation
Until delivery, up to 42 weeks of gestation
From study enrollment until discharge from delivery hospital, up to 30 days after delivery.
secondary_outcome.description: A composite of any of the following: chest pain, pulmonary edema, shortness of breath or hypotension.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From delivery until discharge from the hospital, up to 30 days of age
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as any of the following: respiratory distress syndrome, intraventricular hemorrhage, necrotizing enterocolitis, sepsis or fetal/neonatal death.

arm_group.description: Preterm labor treatment with Magnesium Sulfate.

intervention.description: Preterm labor treatment with Magnesium Sulfate 4 gram bolus followed by 2 gm per hour infusion. 2 Gm bolus as needed and/or rate increase up to 4gm per hour were allowed at the discretion of the treating physician.
Preterm labor treatment with Nifedipine 10 mg. sublingually every 20 minutes for three doses, followed by 20 mg. orally every 4 or 6 hours.

criteria.textblock: Inclusion Criteria::- Uterine contractions and cervical change or ruptured membranes in a preterm gestation Exclusion Criteria:- placental abruption, fetal distress, placenta previa, maternal medical contraindication to tocolysis

results_reference.citation: Lyell DJ, Pullen K, Campbell L, Ching S, Druzin ML, Chitkara U, Burrs D, Caughey AB, El-Sayed YY. Magnesium sulfate compared with nifedipine for acute tocolysis of preterm labor: a randomized controlled trial. Obstet Gynecol. 2007 Jul;110(1):61-7.

group.description: Preterm labor treatment with Magnesium Sulfate. group.description: Preterm labor treatment with Nifedipine. Nifedipine: Preterm labor treatment with Nifedipine 10 mg. sublingually every 20 minutes for three doses, followed by 20 mg. orally every 4 or 6 hours.

outcome.title: Neonatal Birth Weight

outcome.title: Serious Maternal Adverse Effect
outcome.description: A composite of any of the following: chest pain, pulmonary edema, shortness of breath or hypotension.

measure.title: Serious Maternal Adverse Effect

outcome.title: Composite Neonatal Morbidity
outcome.description: Defined as any of the following: respiratory distress syndrome, intraventricular hemorrhage, necrotizing enterocolitis, sepsis or fetal/neonatal death.
outcome.time_frame: From delivery until discharge from the hospital, up to 30 days of age
outcome.population: Data included twins, so the group totals are greater than seen in the Overall Number of Participants Analyzed.

measure.description: Defined as any of the following: respiratory distress syndrome, intraventricular hemorrhage, necrotizing enterocolitis, sepsis or fetal/neonatal death.

reported_events.time_frame: From study enrollment until discharge from the delivery hospital, up to 30 days after delivery.
reported_events.desc: Adverse events were assessed by patient interview from a list of adverse effects and chart review.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
